content.question:
​

The figure shows a child leaning backward and forward when riding a rocking horse. The height, in inches, between the level ground and point <math alttext="P"><semantics><mi>P</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 6 plus 6 cos open parentheses pi over 3 t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the time since the child first leans farthest back, in seconds. If the child rides the rocking horse for <math alttext="5"><semantics><mn>5</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> minutes (<math alttext="300"><semantics><mn>300</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> seconds), how many times will point <math alttext="P"><semantics><mi>P</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> touch the ground?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
